doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 42 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 10/13/1986]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 42 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 10/13/1986]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. President Reagan upsets San Franciscans and persons with AIDS with his homophobic comments2. Former Senator John Schmitz apologizes for his offensive comments regarding pro-choice women and homosexuals3. Philadelphia Lesbian and Gay Task Force offers recommendations for educating homosexual students to school boardCOMMERCIAL: Gay Cable Network fundraiser4. Texas employees attempt to change anti-discrimination laws to include protection for homosexuals5. Andy Humm on acceptance of homophobia in the media6. Newspaper for Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Chicago rejects ad from Catholic groups calling for support of gay civil libertiesCOMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine7. Coverage of the protest against the Georgia sodomy laws and the Rehnquist Supreme CourtCOMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp8. Coverage of protests against Jerry Falwell's rally in support for anti-abortionistsCOMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation with Jose Sarria9. Minneapolis begins media campaign to educate general populace about AIDS10. Study finds that homosexuality in men may be a genetic or familial trait11. Government scientist finds a new AIDS-related virus12. Reading of thank you letters to Gay Cable Network13. Sports Report13. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff BixbyCOMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine2. Interview with director Leslie Irons and actor David Drake regarding their new play, "Dancin' in the Dark," with clipsCOMMERCIAL: GCN's "SUDS" gay soap opera looking for locations3. Coverage and interviews regarding the new film "The Name of the Rose"4. Closing credits
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 42 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 10/13/1986]: October 1986
